meanings.definition: To change the arrangement or formation of something.
meanings.sent1: I will reconfigure my room layout to make space for a new desk.
meanings.sent2: The IT specialist had to reconfigure the network settings for better connectivity.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reconfigure a jigsaw puzzle without all the pieces is like solving a mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her mind began to reconfigure memories, blending reality with dreams.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes reconfigure the blank canvas into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt something to a new or different configuration.
meanings.sent1: We need to reconfigure the seating arrangement for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: The software engineer will reconfigure the code to fix the bug.
meanings.sent3: He tried to reconfigure his failed recipe by adding unusual ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline reconfigures itself as the sun sets behind the buildings.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces can be reconfigured into various shapes for endless fun.
